How to Install nut-xml on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • nut-xml

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install nut-xml on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing nut-xml on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall nut-xml in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install nut-xml, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install nut-xml Using apt

To install nut-xml in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install nut-xml using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install nut-xml

The installation of nut-xml might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install nut-xml Using apt-get

To install nut-xml using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install nut-xml.

sudo apt-get -y install nut-xml

Install nut-xml Using Synaptic

To install nut-xml using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install nut-xml on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for nut-xml. This will display the nut-xml package in the package window, now to install nut-xml, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the nut-xml package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of nut-xml.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install nut-xml Using aptitude

To install nut-xml on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of nut-xml.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install nut-xml using the command aptitude install nut-xml.

sudo aptitude -y install nut-xml

How to Upgrade nut-xml on debian

If you want to upgrade the nut-xml package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade nut-xml using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade nut-xml to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade nut-xml.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade nut-xml sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade nut-xml

Upgrade nut-xml using Aptitude

To upgrade nut-xml using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade nut-xml.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade nut-xml

Upgrade nut-xml using Synaptic

To upgrade nut-xml using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for nut-xml, now right-click nut-xml, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade nut-xml just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall nut-xml on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall nut-xml from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just nut-xml, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove nut-xml

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of nut-xml

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of nut-xml you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge nut-xml

Remove nut-xml using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall nut-xml using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for nut-xml, right-click the nut-xml package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall nut-xml click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install nut-xml on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade nut-xml using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of nut-xml then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
